lead_paragraph: BENJAMIN--Joyce Y.,one of the first black women hired by the New York Telephone Company, died January 30, 2016, at age 85, after battling pancreatic cancer. Joyce Burnett graduated from Hunter College in 1951 and married Earl Benjamin in 1954. After teaching and earning her Master's from Queens College and an Administration degree from Fordham, she had a distinguished career, retiring in 1989 as Director of Pupil Personnel. She loved travel, the arts, and promoted literacy. She is survived by her daughter, Susan Mobley, a business executive; three grandchildren; and her son, Brian. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  BENJAMIN, JOYCE Y.

snippet: BENJAMIN--Joyce Y.,one of the first black women hired by the New York Telephone Company, died January 30, 2016, at age 85, after battling pancreatic cancer. Joyce Burnett graduated from Hunter College in 1951 and married Earl Benjamin in 1954. After teaching and earning her Master's from Queens College and an Administration degree from Fordham, she had a distinguished career, retiring in 1989 as Director of Pupil Personnel. She loved travel, the arts, and promoted literacy. She is survived by her daughter, Susan Mobley, a business executive; three grandchildren; and her son, Brian. 1/3
